3690    /**
3691     * Generate a word from this FakeLanguageGen using the specified StatefulRNG with an approximate number of
3692     * syllables, potentially setting the state of rng mid-way through the word to another seed from {@code reseeds}
3693     * more than once if the word is long enough. This overload is less likely to be used very often.
3694     *
3695     * @param rng        the StatefulRNG to use for the randomized string building
3696     * @param capitalize true if the word should start with a capital letter, false otherwise
3697     * @param approxSyllables the approximate number of syllables to produce in the word; there may be more syllables
3698     * @param reseeds an array or varargs of additional long seeds to seed {@code rng} with mid-generation 
3699     * @return a word in the fake language as a String
3700     */
3701    public String word(IStatefulRNG rng, boolean capitalize, int approxSyllables, long... reseeds) {
3702        if (approxSyllables <= 0) {
3703            sb.setLength(0);
3704            sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(openingVowels));
3705            for (int m = 0; m < modifiers.size(); m++) {
3706                modifiers.get(m).modify(rng, sb);
3707            }
3708            if (capitalize) sb.setCharAt(0, Character.toUpperCase(sb.charAt(0)));
3709            return sb.toString();
3710        }
3711        int numSeeds, fraction = 1;
3712        if (reseeds != null)
3713            numSeeds = Math.min(reseeds.length, approxSyllables - 1);
3714        else numSeeds = 0;
3715        while (true) {
3716            sb.setLength(0);
3717            ender.setLength(0);
3718            int i = 0;
3719            if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelStartFrequency) {
3720                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(openingVowels));
3721                if (approxSyllables == 1)
3722                    sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(closingConsonants));
3723                else
3724                    sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midConsonants));
3725                i++;
3726            } else {
3727                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(openingConsonants));
3728            }
3729            String close = "";
3730            boolean redouble = false;
3731            if (i < approxSyllables) {
3732                if (numSeeds > 0 && i > 0 && i == approxSyllables * fraction / (1 + numSeeds))
3733                    rng.setState(reseeds[fraction++ - 1]);
3734                if (rng.nextDouble() < syllableEndFrequency) {
3735                    close = rng.getRandomElement(closingSyllables);
3736                    if (close.contains("@") && (approxSyllables & 1) == 0) {
3737                        redouble = true;
3738                        approxSyllables = approxSyllables >> 1;
3739                    }
3740                    if (!close.contains("@"))
3741                        ender.append(close);
3742                    else if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelEndFrequency) {
3743                        ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
3744                        if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelSplitFrequency) {
3745                            ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(vowelSplitters))
3746                                    .append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
3747                        }
3748                    }
3749                } else {
3750                    ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
3751                    if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelSplitFrequency) {
3752                        ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(vowelSplitters))
3753                                .append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
3754                    }
3755                    if (rng.nextDouble() >= vowelEndFrequency) {
3756                        ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(closingConsonants));
3757                        if (rng.nextDouble() < syllableEndFrequency) {
3758                            close = rng.getRandomElement(closingSyllables);
3759                            if (close.contains("@") && (approxSyllables & 1) == 0) {
3760                                redouble = true;
3761                                approxSyllables = approxSyllables >> 1;
3762
3763                                //sb.append(close.replaceAll("@\\d", sb.toString()));
3764                            }
3765                            if (!close.contains("@"))
3766                                ender.append(close);
3767                        }
3768                    }
3769                }
3770                i += vowelClusters.matcher(ender).findAll().count();
3771            }
3772
3773            for (; i < approxSyllables; i++) {
3774                if (numSeeds > 0 && i > 0 && i == approxSyllables * fraction / (1 + numSeeds))
3775                    rng.setState(reseeds[fraction++ - 1]);
3776                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
3777                if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelSplitFrequency) {
3778                    sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(vowelSplitters))
3779                            .append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
3780                }
3781                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midConsonants));
3782            }
3783
3784            sb.append(ender);
3785            if (redouble && i <= approxSyllables + 1) {
3786                sb.append(close.replaceAll("@", sb.toString()));
3787            }
3788
3789            if (sanityChecks != null && !checkAll(sb, sanityChecks))
3790                continue;
3791
3792            for (int m = 0; m < modifiers.size(); m++) {
3793                modifiers.get(m).modify(rng, sb);
3794            }
3795
3796            if (capitalize)
3797                sb.setCharAt(0, Character.toUpperCase(sb.charAt(0)));
3798
3799            if (clean && !checkAll(sb, vulgarChecks))
3800                continue;
3801            return sb.toString();
3802        }
3803    }

3893    /**
3894     * Generate a sentence from this FakeLanguageGen using the specific RNG. The sentence's length in
3895     * words will be between minWords and maxWords, both inclusive. It will put one of the punctuation Strings from
3896     * {@code midPunctuation} between two words (before the space) at a frequency of {@code midPunctuationFrequency}
3897     * (between 0 and 1), and will end the sentence with one String chosen from {@code endPunctuation}.
3898     *
3899     * @param rng                     the RNG to use for the randomized string building
3900     * @param minWords                an int for the minimum number of words in a sentence; should be at least 1
3901     * @param maxWords                an int for the maximum number of words in a sentence; should be at least equal to minWords
3902     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
3903     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
3904     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
3905     *                                the very end of a sentence
3906     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
3907     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
3908     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
3909     */
3910    public String sentence(IRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
3911                           double midPunctuationFrequency) {
3912        if (minWords < 1)
3913            minWords = 1;
3914        if (minWords > maxWords)
3915            maxWords = minWords;
3916        if (midPunctuationFrequency > 1.0) {
3917            midPunctuationFrequency = 1.0 / midPunctuationFrequency;
3918        }
3919        ssb.setLength(0);
3920        ssb.ensureCapacity(12 * maxWords);
3921        ssb.append(word(rng, true));
3922        for (int i = 1; i < minWords; i++) {
3923            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency) {
3924                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
3925            }
3926            ssb.append(' ').append(word(rng, false));
3927        }
3928        for (int i = minWords; i < maxWords && rng.nextInt(2 * maxWords) > i; i++) {
3929            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency) {
3930                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
3931            }
3932            ssb.append(' ').append(word(rng, false));
3933        }
3934        if (endPunctuation != null && endPunctuation.length > 0)
3935            ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(endPunctuation));
3936        return ssb.toString();
3937    }

3972     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
3973     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
3974     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
3975     *                                the very end of a sentence
3976     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
3977     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces

3979     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String

3987    /**
3988     * Generate a sentence from this FakeLanguageGen using the given RNG that fits in the given length limit. The
3989     * sentence's length in words will be between minWords and maxWords, both inclusive, unless it would exceed
3990     * maxChars, in which case it is truncated. It will put one of the punctuation Strings from {@code midPunctuation}
3991     * between two words (before the space) at a frequency of {@code midPunctuationFrequency} (between 0 and 1), and
3992     * will end the sentence with one String chosen from {@code endPunctuation}.
3993     *
3994     * @param rng                     the RNG to use for the randomized string building
3995     * @param minWords                an int for the minimum number of words in a sentence; should be at least 1
3996     * @param maxWords                an int for the maximum number of words in a sentence; should be at least equal to minWords
3997     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
3998     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
3999     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
4000     *                                the very end of a sentence
4001     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
4002     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
4003     * @param maxChars                the longest string length this can produce; should be at least {@code 6 * minWords}
4004     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
4005     */
4006    public String sentence(IRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
4007                           double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars) {
4008        if(maxChars < 0)
4009            return sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midPunctuationFrequency);
4010        if (minWords < 1)
4011            minWords = 1;
4012        if (minWords > maxWords)
4013            maxWords = minWords;
4014        if (midPunctuationFrequency > 1.0) {
4015            midPunctuationFrequency = 1.0 / midPunctuationFrequency;
4016        }
4017        if (maxChars < 4)
4018            return "!";
4019        if (maxChars <= 5 * minWords) {
4020            minWords = 1;
4021            maxWords = 1;
4022        }
4023        int frustration = 0;
4024        ssb.setLength(0); 
4025        ssb.ensureCapacity(maxChars);
4026        String next = word(rng, true);
4027        while (next.length() >= maxChars - 1 && frustration < 50) {
4028            next = word(rng, true);
4029            frustration++;
4030        }
4031        if (frustration >= 50) return "!";
4032        ssb.append(next);
4033        for (int i = 1; i < minWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7; i++) {
4034            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4035                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4036            }
4037            next = word(rng, false);
4038            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4039                next = word(rng, false);
4040                frustration++;
4041            }
4042            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4043            ssb.append(' ').append(next);
4044        }
4045        for (int i = minWords; i < maxWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7 && rng.nextInt(2 * maxWords) > i && frustration < 50; i++) {
4046            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4047                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4048            }
4049            next = word(rng, false);
4050            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4051                next = word(rng, false);
4052                frustration++;
4053            }
4054            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4055            ssb.append(' ');
4056            ssb.append(next);
4057        }
4058
4059        if (endPunctuation != null && endPunctuation.length > 0) {
4060
4061            next = rng.getRandomElement(endPunctuation);
4062            if (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars)
4063                ssb.append('.');
4064            else
4065                ssb.append(next);
4066        }
4067
4068        if (ssb.length() > maxChars)
4069            return "!";
4070        return ssb.toString();
4071    }
4072
4073    protected String[] merge1000(IRNG rng, String[] me, String[] other, double otherInfluence) {
4074        if (other.length <= 0 && me.length <= 0)
4075            return new String[]{};
4076        String[] ret = new String[1000];
4077        int otherCount = (int) (1000 * otherInfluence);
4078        int idx = 0;
4079        if (other.length > 0) {
4080            String[] tmp = new String[other.length];
4081            rng.shuffle(other, tmp);
4082            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4083                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4084            }
4085        }
4086        if (me.length > 0) {
4087            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4088            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4089            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4090                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4091            }
4092        } else {
4093            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4094                ret[idx] = other[idx % other.length];
4095            }
4096        }
4097        return ret;
4098    }

4106        if (me.length > 0) {
4107            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4108            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4109            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4110                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length]
4111                        .replace('a', accentedVowels[0][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[0].length)])
4112                        .replace('e', accentedVowels[1][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[1].length)])
4113                        .replace('i', accentedVowels[2][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[2].length)])
4114                        .replace('o', accentedVowels[3][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[3].length)])

4118                    ret[idx] = matcher.replaceAll(rng.getRandomElement(me));
4119                }
4120            }
4121            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4122                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4123            }
4124        } else
4125            return new String[]{};

4265    /**
4266     * Makes a new FakeLanguageGen that mixes this object with {@code other}, mingling the consonants and vowels they
4267     * use as well as any word suffixes or other traits, and favoring the qualities in {@code other} by
4268     * {@code otherInfluence}, which will value both languages evenly if it is 0.5 . 
4269     * @param other another FakeLanguageGen to mix along with this one into a new language
4270     * @param otherInfluence how much other should affect the pair, with 0.5 being equal and 1.0 being only other used
4271     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with traits from both languages
4272     */
4273    public FakeLanguageGen mix(FakeLanguageGen other, double otherInfluence) {
4274        otherInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(otherInfluence, 1.0));
4275        double myInfluence = 1.0 - otherInfluence;
4276
4277        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(), other.hashCode() ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(otherInfluence));
4278
4279        String[] ov = merge1000(rng, openingVowels, other.openingVowels, otherInfluence),
4280                mv = merge1000(rng, midVowels, other.midVowels, otherInfluence),
4281                oc = merge1000(rng, openingConsonants, other.openingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4282                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelStartFrequency + vowelStartFrequency))),
4283                mc = merge1000(rng, midConsonants, other.midConsonants, otherInfluence),
4284                cc = merge1000(rng, closingConsonants, other.closingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4285                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelEndFrequency + vowelEndFrequency))),
4286                cs = merge1000(rng, closingSyllables, other.closingSyllables, otherInfluence *
4287                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, other.syllableEndFrequency - syllableEndFrequency))),
4288                splitters = merge1000(rng, vowelSplitters, other.vowelSplitters, otherInfluence);
4289
4290        double[] fr = new double[Math.max(syllableFrequencies.length, other.syllableFrequencies.length)];
4291        System.arraycopy(syllableFrequencies, 0, fr, 0, syllableFrequencies.length);
4292        for (int i = 0; i < other.syllableFrequencies.length; i++) {
4293            fr[i] += other.syllableFrequencies[i];
4294        }
4295        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(modifiers.size() + other.modifiers.size());
4296        mods.addAll(modifiers);
4297        mods.addAll(other.modifiers);
4298        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, splitters, fr,
4299                vowelStartFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelStartFrequency * otherInfluence,
4300                vowelEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4301                vowelSplitFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelSplitFrequency * otherInfluence,
4302                syllableEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.syllableEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4303                (sanityChecks == null) ? other.sanityChecks : sanityChecks, true, mods)
4304                .setName(otherInfluence > 0.5 ? other.name + "/" + name : name + "/" + other.name);
4305    }
4306
4307    private static double readDouble(Object o) {
4308        if (o instanceof Double) return (Double) o;
4309        else if (o instanceof Float) return (Float) o;
4310        else if (o instanceof Long) return ((Long) o).doubleValue();
4311        else if (o instanceof Integer) return (Integer) o;
4312        else if (o instanceof Short) return (Short) o;
4313        else if (o instanceof Byte) return (Byte) o;
4314        else if (o instanceof Character) return (Character) o;
4315        return 0.0;
4316    }
4317
4318    /**
4319     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen by mixing this FakeLanguageGen with one or more other FakeLanguageGen objects. Takes
4320     * a weight for this, another FakeLanguageGen, a weight for that FakeLanguageGen, then a possibly-empty group of
4321     * FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters. If other1 is null or if pairs has been given a
4322     * value of null instead of the normal (possibly empty) array of Objects, then this simply returns a copy of this
4323     * FakeLanguageGen. Otherwise, it will at least mix this language with other1 using the given weights for each.
4324     * If pairs is not empty, it has special requirements for what types it allows and in what order, but does no type
4325     * checking. Specifically, pairs requires the first Object to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some
4326     * kind that will be the weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and
4327     * converts them to Double if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern
4328     * (FakeLanguageGen, then number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4329     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4330     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4331     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4332     * with 0.33 .
4333     * <br>
4334     * Unlike the static method {@link #mixAll(Object...)}, this _is_ intended for external use, in part because the
4335     * technique for mixing languages by weight is so much more intuitive, but also because this assigns valid data for
4336     * serializing and deserializing this FakeLanguageGen that allows it to use significantly less space (less than 1/72
4337     * the bytes used in one not-quite-simple test).
4338     *
4339     * @param myWeight the weight to assign this FakeLanguageGen in the mix
4340     * @param other1   another FakeLanguageGen to mix in; if null, this method will abort and return {@link #copy()}
4341     * @param weight1  the weight to assign other1 in the mix
4342     * @param pairs    may be empty, not null; otherwise must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4343     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing this with any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4344     */
4345    public FakeLanguageGen mix(double myWeight, FakeLanguageGen other1, double weight1, Object... pairs) {
4346        if (other1 == null || pairs == null)
4347            return copy();
4348        OrderedSet<Modifier> mods = new OrderedSet<>(modifiers);
4349        FakeLanguageGen mixer = removeModifiers();
4350        FakeLanguageGen[] languages = new FakeLanguageGen[2 + (pairs.length >>> 1)];
4351        double[] weights = new double[languages.length];
4352        String[] summaries = new String[languages.length];
4353        boolean summarize = true;
4354        double total = 0.0, current, weight;
4355        languages[0] = mixer;
4356        total += weights[0] = myWeight;
4357        if ((summaries[0] = mixer.summary) == null) summarize = false;
4358        mods.addAll(other1.modifiers);
4359        languages[1] = other1.removeModifiers();
4360        total += weights[1] = weight1;
4361        if (summarize && (summaries[1] = languages[1].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4362        for (int i = 1, p = 2; i < pairs.length; i += 2, p++) {
4363            if (pairs[i] == null || pairs[i - 1] == null)
4364                continue;
4365            languages[p] = ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[i - 1]).removeModifiers();
4366            total += weights[p] = readDouble(pairs[i]);
4367            if (summarize && (summaries[p] = languages[p].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4368        }
4369        if (total == 0)
4370            return copy();
4371        current = myWeight / total;
4372        for (int i = 1; i < languages.length; i++) {
4373            if ((weight = weights[i]) > 0)
4374                mixer = mixer.mix(languages[i], weight / total / (current += weight / total));
4375        }
4376        if (summarize) {
4377            sb.setLength(0);
4378            String c;
4379            int idx;
4380            for (int i = 0; i < summaries.length; i++) {
4381                c = summaries[i];
4382                idx = c.indexOf('@');
4383                if (idx >= 0) {
4384                    sb.append(c, 0, idx + 1).append(weights[i]);
4385                    if (i < summaries.length - 1)
4386                        sb.append('~');
4387                }
4388            }
4389            for (int i = 0; i < mods.size(); i++) {
4390                sb.append('℗').append(mods.getAt(i).serializeToString());
4391            }
4392            return mixer.addModifiers(mods).summarize(sb.toString());
4393        } else
4394            return mixer.addModifiers(mods);
4395    }
4396
4397    /**
4398     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen from a group of FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters.
4399     * Requires the first Object in pairs to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some kind that will be the
4400     * weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and converts them to Double
4401     * if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern (FakeLanguageGen, then
4402     * number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). There should be at least 4 elements in pairs, half of them
4403     * languages and half of them weights, for this to do any mixing, but it can produce a result with as little as one
4404     * FakeLanguageGen (returning a copy of the first FakeLanguageGen). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4405     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4406     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4407     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4408     * with 0.33 .
4409     * <br>
4410     * Not intended for external use, but it could be useful. Used internally in the deserialization code.
4411     *
4412     * @param pairs should have at least one item, and must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4413     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4414     */
4415    public static FakeLanguageGen mixAll(Object... pairs) {
4416        int len;
4417        if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 0)
4418            return ENGLISH.copy();
4419        if (len < 4)
4420            return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).copy();
4421        Object[] pairs2 = new Object[len - 4];
4422        if (len > 4)
4423            System.arraycopy(pairs, 4, pairs2, 0, len - 4);
4424        return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).mix(readDouble(pairs[1]), (FakeLanguageGen) pairs[2], readDouble(pairs[3]), pairs2);
4425    }
4426
4427    /**
4428     * Produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with extra vowels and/or consonants possible, adding from a wide
4429     * selection of accented vowels (if vowelInfluence is above 0.0) and/or consonants (if consonantInfluence is above
4430     * 0.0). This may produce a gibberish-looking language with no rhyme or reason to the accents, and generally
4431     * consonantInfluence should be very low if it is above 0 at all.
4432     * @param vowelInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect vowels at all
4433     * @param consonantInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect consonants at all
4434     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with modifications to add accented vowels and/or consonants
4435     */
4436    public FakeLanguageGen addAccents(double vowelInfluence, double consonantInfluence) {
4437        vowelInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(vowelInfluence, 1.0));
4438        consonantInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(consonantInfluence, 1.0));
4439        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(),
4440                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelInfluence)
4441                        ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(consonantInfluence));
4442        String[] ov = accentVowels(rng, openingVowels, vowelInfluence),
4443                mv = accentVowels(rng, midVowels, vowelInfluence),
4444                oc = accentConsonants(rng, openingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4445                mc = accentConsonants(rng, midConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4446                cc = accentConsonants(rng, closingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4447                cs = accentBoth(rng, closingSyllables, vowelInfluence, consonantInfluence);
4448
4449
4450        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4451                vowelStartFrequency,
4452                vowelEndFrequency,
4453                vowelSplitFrequency,
4454                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers).setName(name + "-Bònüs");
4455    }
4456
4457    private static String[] copyStrings(String[] start) {
4458        String[] next = new String[start.length];
4459        System.arraycopy(start, 0, next, 0, start.length);
4460        return next;
4461    }

4463    /**
4464     * Useful for cases with limited fonts, this produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with all accented
4465     * characters removed (including almost all non-ASCII Latin-alphabet characters, but only some Greek and Cyrillic
4466     * characters). This will replace letters like "A with a ring" with just "A". Some of the letters chosen as
4467     * replacements aren't exact matches.
4468     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but without accented letters
4469     */
4470    public FakeLanguageGen removeAccents() {
4471
4472        String[] ov = copyStrings(openingVowels),
4473                mv = copyStrings(midVowels),
4474                oc = copyStrings(openingConsonants),
4475                mc = copyStrings(midConsonants),
4476                cc = copyStrings(closingConsonants),
4477                cs = copyStrings(closingSyllables);
4478        for (int i = 0; i < ov.length; i++) {
4479            ov[i] = removeAccents(openingVowels[i]).toString();
4480        }
4481        for (int i = 0; i < mv.length; i++) {
4482            mv[i] = removeAccents(midVowels[i]).toString();
4483        }
4484        for (int i = 0; i < oc.length; i++) {
4485            oc[i] = removeAccents(openingConsonants[i]).toString();
4486        }
4487        for (int i = 0; i < mc.length; i++) {
4488            mc[i] = removeAccents(midConsonants[i]).toString();
4489        }
4490        for (int i = 0; i < cc.length; i++) {
4491            cc[i] = removeAccents(closingConsonants[i]).toString();
4492        }
4493        for (int i = 0; i < cs.length; i++) {
4494            cs[i] = removeAccents(closingSyllables[i]).toString();
4495        }
4496
4497        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4498                vowelStartFrequency,
4499                vowelEndFrequency,
4500                vowelSplitFrequency,
4501                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers);
4502    }

4505     * Returns the name of this FakeLanguageGen, such as "English" or "Deep Speech", if one was registered for this.
4506     * In the case of hybrid languages produced by {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} or related methods, this should
4507     * produce a String like "English/French" (or "English/French/Maori" if more are mixed together). If no name was
4508     * registered, this will return "Nameless Language".
4509     * @return the human-readable name of this language, or "Nameless Language" if none is known
4510     */

4579    @Override
4580    public boolean equals(Object o) {
4581        if (this == o) return true;
4582        if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
4583
4584        FakeLanguageGen that = (FakeLanguageGen) o;
4585
4586        if (clean != that.clean) return false;
4587        if (Double.compare(that.totalSyllableFrequency, totalSyllableFrequency) != 0) return false;
4588        if (Double.compare(that.vowelStartFrequency, vowelStartFrequency) != 0) return false;
4589        if (Double.compare(that.vowelEndFrequency, vowelEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4590        if (Double.compare(that.vowelSplitFrequency, vowelSplitFrequency) != 0) return false;
4591        if (Double.compare(that.syllableEndFrequency, syllableEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4592        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4593        if (!Arrays.equals(openingVowels, that.openingVowels)) return false;
4594        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4595        if (!Arrays.equals(midVowels, that.midVowels)) return false;
4596        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4597        if (!Arrays.equals(openingConsonants, that.openingConsonants)) return false;
4598        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4599        if (!Arrays.equals(midConsonants, that.midConsonants)) return false;
4600        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4601        if (!Arrays.equals(closingConsonants, that.closingConsonants)) return false;
4602        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4603        if (!Arrays.equals(vowelSplitters, that.vowelSplitters)) return false;
4604        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4605        if (!Arrays.equals(closingSyllables, that.closingSyllables)) return false;
4606        if (!Arrays.equals(syllableFrequencies, that.syllableFrequencies)) return false;
4607        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4608        if (!Arrays.equals(sanityChecks, that.sanityChecks)) return false;
4609        return modifiers != null ? modifiers.equals(that.modifiers) : that.modifiers == null;
4610    }
4611
4612    @Override
4613    public int hashCode() {
4614        int result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 +
4615                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(openingVowels) +
4616                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(midVowels) +
4617                31 * CrossHash.hash(openingConsonants) +
4618                CrossHash.hash(midConsonants) | 0;
4619        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4620                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(closingConsonants) +
4621                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(vowelSplitters) +
4622                31 * CrossHash.hash(closingSyllables) ^
4623                (clean ? 1 : 0);
4624        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4625                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(syllableFrequencies) +
4626                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(totalSyllableFrequency) +
4627                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelStartFrequency) +
4628                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelEndFrequency) | 0;
4629        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4630                31 * 31 * 31 * (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1 : 0) +
4631                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(syllableEndFrequency) +                 
4632                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelSplitFrequency) | 0;
4633        if(modifiers != null) {
4634            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4635                result = result + 7 * (i + 1) * modifiers.get(i).hashCode() | 0;
4636            }
4637        }
4638        return result;
4639    }
4640    public long hash64() {
4641        long result           = CrossHash.hash64(openingVowels);
4642        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midVowels);
4643        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(openingConsonants);
4644        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midConsonants);
4645        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingConsonants);
4646        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(vowelSplitters);
4647        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingSyllables);
4648        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(syllableFrequencies);
4649        result = 31L * result + (clean ? 1L : 0L);
4650        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(totalSyllableFrequency);
4651        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelStartFrequency);
4652        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelEndFrequency);
4653        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelSplitFrequency);
4654        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(syllableEndFrequency);
4655        result = 31L * result + (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1L : 0L);
4656        result *= 31L;
4657        if(modifiers != null) {
4658            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4659                result += 7L * (i + 1L) * CrossHash.hash64(modifiers.get(i).alterations);
4660            }
4661        }
4662        return result;
4663    }

4699    public static FakeLanguageGen deserializeFromString(String data) {
4700        if (data == null || data.equals(""))
4701            return ENGLISH.copy();
4702        int poundIndex = data.indexOf('#'), snailIndex = data.indexOf('@'), tempBreak = data.indexOf('℗'),
4703                breakIndex = (tempBreak < 0) ? data.length() : tempBreak,
4704                tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~'), breakIndex), prevTildeIndex = -1;
4705        if (tildeIndex < 0)
4706            tildeIndex = data.length();
4707
4708        if (snailIndex < 0)
4709            return ENGLISH.copy();
4710        ArrayList<Object> pairs = new ArrayList<>(4);
4711        while (snailIndex >= 0) {
4712            if (poundIndex >= 0 && poundIndex < snailIndex) // random case
4713            {
4714                pairs.add(randomLanguage(Long.parseLong(data.substring(poundIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
4715                pairs.add(Double.valueOf(data.substring(snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex)));
4716                poundIndex = -1;
4717            } else {
4718                pairs.add(registry.getAt(Integer.parseInt(data.substring(prevTildeIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
4719                pairs.add(Double.valueOf(data.substring(snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex)));
4720            }
4721            snailIndex = data.indexOf('@', snailIndex + 1);
4722            if (snailIndex > breakIndex)
4723                break;
4724            prevTildeIndex = tildeIndex;
4725            tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~', tildeIndex + 1), breakIndex);
4726            if (tildeIndex < 0)
4727                tildeIndex = data.length();
4728        }
4729        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(8);
4730        if (breakIndex == tempBreak) {
4731            tildeIndex = breakIndex - 1;
4732            while ((prevTildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', tildeIndex + 1)) >= 0) {
4733                tildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', prevTildeIndex + 1);
4734                if (tildeIndex < 0) tildeIndex = data.length();
4735                mods.add(Modifier.deserializeFromString(data.substring(prevTildeIndex, tildeIndex)));
4736            }
4737        }
4738        FakeLanguageGen flg = mixAll(pairs.toArray());
4739        flg.modifiers.addAll(mods);
4740        return flg;
4741    }
4742
4743    public static class Modifier implements Serializable {
4744        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1734863678490422371L;
4745        private transient static final StringBuilder modSB = new StringBuilder(32);
4746        public final Alteration[] alterations;
4747
4748        public Modifier() {
4749            alterations = new Alteration[0];
4750        }
4751
4752        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement) {
4753            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement)};
4754        }
4755
4756        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
4757            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement, chance)};
4758        }
4759
4760        public Modifier(Alteration... alts) {
4761            alterations = (alts == null) ? new Alteration[0] : alts;
4762        }
4763
4764        public StringBuilder modify(IRNG rng, StringBuilder sb) {
4765            Matcher m;
4766            Replacer.StringBuilderBuffer tb;
4767            boolean found;
4768            Alteration alt;
4769            for (int a = 0; a < alterations.length; a++) {
4770                alt = alterations[a];
4771                modSB.setLength(0);
4772                tb = Replacer.wrap(modSB);
4773                m = alt.replacer.getPattern().matcher(sb);
4774
4775                found = false;
4776                while (true) {
4777                    if (alt.chance >= 1 || rng.nextDouble() < alt.chance) {
4778                        if (!Replacer.replaceStep(m, alt.replacer.getSubstitution(), tb))
4779                            break;
4780                        found = true;
4781                    } else {
4782                        if (!m.find())
4783                            break;
4784                        found = true;
4785                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.PREFIX, tb);
4786                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.MATCH, tb);
4787                        m.setTarget(m, MatchResult.SUFFIX);
4788                    }
4789                }
4790                if (found) {
4791                    m.getGroup(MatchResult.TARGET, tb);
4792                    sb.setLength(0);
4793                    sb.append(modSB);
4794                }
4795            }
4796            return sb;
4797        }

4838        /**
4839         * Removes accented letters and the two non-English consonants from text generated with {@link #NORSE}.
4840         * Replaces á, é, í, ý, ó, æ, ú, and ö with a, e, i, y, o, ae, and ou. In some instances, replaces j
4841         * with y. Replaces ð and þ with th and th, except for when preceded by s (then it replaces sð or sþ
4842         * with st or st) or when the start of a word is fð or fþ, where it replaces with fr or fr.
4843         */
4844        public static final Modifier SIMPLIFY_NORSE = replacementTable(
4845                "á", "a",
4846                "é", "e",
4847                "í", "i",
4848                "ý", "y",
4849                "ó", "o",
4850                "ú", "u",
4851                "æ", "ae",
4852                "ö", "ou",
4853                "([^aeiou])jy", "$1yai",
4854                "([^aeiou])j(?:[aeiouy]+)", "$1yo",
4855                "s([ðþ])", "st",
4856                "\\bf[ðþ]", "fr",
4857                "[ðþ]", "th");

4861         */
4862        public static final Modifier LIGATURES = replacementTable("ae", "æ", "oe", "œ", "áe", "ǽ", "aé", "ǽ", "áé", "ǽ");

4865         * for fixing a word that isn't pronounceable.

4874                "([æǽœ])[àáâãäåāăąǻaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]", "$1",

4881        /**
4882         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth char in initial with the nth char in change. Expects initial and
4883         * change to be the same length, but will use the lesser length if they are not equal-length. Because of the
4884         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
4885         *
4886         * @param initial a String containing lower-case letters or other symbols to be swapped out of a text
4887         * @param change  a String containing characters that will replace occurrences of characters in initial
4888         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
4889         */
4890        public static Modifier charReplacementTable(String initial, String change) {
4891            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[Math.min(initial.length(), change.length())];
4892            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
4893                //literal string syntax; avoids sensitive escaping issues and also doesn't need a character class,
4894                // which is slightly slower and has some odd escaping cases.
4895                alts[i] = new Alteration("\\Q" + initial.charAt(i), change.substring(i, i + 1));
4896            }
4897            return new Modifier(alts);
4898        }
4899
4900        /**
4901         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth String key in map with the nth value. Because of the
4902         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
4903         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex pattern strings as keys and replacement syntax,
4904         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
4905         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
4906         * The ordering of map matters if a later key contains an earlier key (the earlier one will be replaced
4907         * first, possibly making the later key not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
4908         * become valid.
4909         *
4910         * @param map containing String keys to replace and String values to use instead; replacements happen in order
4911         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
4912         */
4913        public static Modifier replacementTable(OrderedMap<String, String> map) {
4914            if (map == null)
4915                return new Modifier();
4916            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[map.size()];
4917            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
4918                alts[i] = new Alteration(map.keyAt(i), map.getAt(i));
4919            }
4920            return new Modifier(alts);
4921        }
4922
4923        /**
4924         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the (n*2)th String in pairs with the (n*2+1)th value in pairs. Because
4925         * of the state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
4926         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex syntax for search and replacement Strings,
4927         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
4928         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
4929         * The ordering of pairs matters if a later search contains an earlier search (the earlier one will be replaced
4930         * first, possibly making the later search not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
4931         * become valid.
4932         *
4933         * @param pairs array or vararg of alternating Strings to search for and Strings to replace with; replacements happen in order
4934         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
4935         */
4936        public static Modifier replacementTable(String... pairs) {
4937            int len;
4938            if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 1)
4939                return new Modifier();
4940            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[len >> 1];
4941            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
4942                alts[i] = new Alteration(pairs[i<< 1], pairs[i<<1|1]);
4943            }
4944            return new Modifier(alts);
4945        }

4947        /**
4948         * Adds the potential for the String {@code insertion} to be used as a vowel in addition to the vowels that the
4949         * language already uses; insertion will replace an existing vowel (at any point in a word that had a vowel
4950         * generated) with a probability of {@code chance}, so chance should be low (0.1 at most) unless you want the
4951         * newly-inserted vowel to be likely to be present in every word of some sentences.
4952         * @param insertion the String to use as an additional vowel
4953         * @param chance the chance for a vowel cluster to be replaced with insertion; normally 0.1 or less
4954         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
4955         */
4956        public static Modifier insertVowel(String insertion, double chance)
4957        {
4958            return new Modifier(anyVowelCluster, insertion, chance);
4959        }

5085        @Override
5086        public boolean equals(Object o) {
5087            if (this == o) return true;
5088            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
5089
5090            Modifier modifier = (Modifier) o;
5091
5092            // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
5093            return Arrays.equals(alterations, modifier.alterations);
5094        }
5095
5096        @Override
5097        public int hashCode() {
5098            return CrossHash.hash(alterations);
5099        }
5100
5101        @Override
5102        public String toString() {
5103            return "Modifier{" +
5104                    "alterations=" + Arrays.toString(alterations) +
5105                    '}';
5106        }
5107
5108        public String serializeToString() {
5109            if (alterations.length == 0) return "\6";
5110            modSB.setLength(0);
5111            modSB.append('\6');
5112            for (int i = 0; i < alterations.length; i++)
5113                modSB.append(alterations[i].serializeToString()).append('\6');
5114            return modSB.toString();
5115        }
5116
5117        public static Modifier deserializeFromString(String data) {
5118            int currIdx = data.indexOf(6), altIdx = currIdx, matches = 0;
5119            while (currIdx >= 0) {
5120                if ((currIdx = data.indexOf(6, currIdx + 1)) < 0)
5121                    break;
5122                matches++;
5123            }
5124            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[matches];
5125            for (int i = 0; i < matches; i++) {
5126                alts[i] = Alteration.deserializeFromString(data.substring(altIdx + 1, altIdx = data.indexOf(6, altIdx + 1)));
5127            }
5128            return new Modifier(alts);
5129        }
5130    }
5131
5132    public static class Alteration implements Serializable {
5133        private static final long serialVersionUID = -2138854697837563188L;
5134        public Replacer replacer;
5135        public String replacement;
5136        public double chance;
5137
5138        public Alteration() {
5139            this("[tţťț]?[sśŝşšș]+h?", "th");
5140        }
5141
5142        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement) {
5143            this.replacement = replacement;
5144            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5145            chance = 1.0;
5146        }
5147
5148        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5149            this.replacement = replacement;
5150            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5151            this.chance = chance;
5152        }
5153
5154        public Alteration(Pattern pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5155            this.replacement = replacement;
5156            replacer = pattern.replacer(replacement);
5157            this.chance = chance;
5158        }
5159
5160        @Override
5161        public boolean equals(Object o) {
5162            if (this == o) return true;
5163            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
5164
5165            Alteration that = (Alteration) o;
5166
5167            if (Double.compare(that.chance, chance) != 0) return false;
5168            return replacer.equals(that.replacer);
5169
5170        }
5171
5172        @Override
5173        public int hashCode() {
5174            long result;
5175            result = CrossHash.hash64(replacer.getPattern().serializeToString());
5176            result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(chance);
5177            result ^= result >>> 32;
5178            return (int) (0xFFFFFFFFL & result);
5179        }
5180
5181        @Override
5182        public String toString() {
5183            return "Alteration{" +
5184                    "replacer=" + replacer +
5185                    ", chance=" + chance +
5186                    '}';
5187        }
5188
5189        public String serializeToString() {
5190            return replacer.getPattern().serializeToString() + '\2' + replacement + '\4' + chance;
5191        }
5192
5193        public static Alteration deserializeFromString(String data) {
5194            int split2 = data.indexOf('\2'), split4 = data.indexOf('\4');
5195            return new Alteration(Pattern.deserializeFromString(data.substring(0, split2)),
5196                    data.substring(split2 + 1, split4),
5197                    Double.parseDouble(data.substring(split4 + 1)));
5198        }
5199    }

5201    /**
5202     * A simple way to bundle a FakeLanguageGen with the arguments that would be passed to it when calling
5203     * {@link FakeLanguageGen#sentence(IRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} or one of its overloads.
5204     * You can call {@link #sentence()} on this to produce another String sentence with the parameters it was given
5205     * at construction. The parameters to
5206     * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, IStatefulRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} are stored in fields of
5207     * the same name, and all fields in this class are public and modifiable.
5208     */
5209    public static class SentenceForm implements Serializable
5210    {
5211        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1246527948419533147L;
5212        public IStatefulRNG rng;
5213        public int minWords, maxWords, maxChars;
5214        public String[] midPunctuation, endPunctuation;
5215        public double midPunctuationFrequency;
5216        public FakeLanguageGen language;
5217
5218        /**
5219         * Builds a SentenceForm with all default fields, using {@link FakeLanguageGen#FANTASY_NAME} for a language,
5220         * using between 1 and 9 words in a sentence, and otherwise defaulting to how
5221         * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, int, int)} behaves.
5222         */
5223        public SentenceForm()
5224        {
5225            this(FakeLanguageGen.FANTASY_NAME, FakeLanguageGen.srng, 1, 9,
5226                    mid,
5227                    end, 0.18, -1);
5228        }
5229        /**
5230         * Builds a SentenceForm with only a few fields specified. The {@link #rng} will be made based on
5231         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, maxChars will be -1 so the sentence length
5232         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced, and the between-word and end-of-sentence
5233         * punctuation will be set to reasonable defaults. This places either a comma or a semicolon after a word in the
5234         * middle of a sentence about 18% of the time ({@code midPunctuationFrequency} is 0.18), and can end a sentence
5235         * in a period, exclamation mark, question mark, or ellipsis (the "..." punctuation).
5236         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5237         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5238         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5239         */
5240        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords)
5241        {
5242            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, mid,
5243                    end, 0.18, -1);
5244        }
5245        /**
5246         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5247         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, and maxChars, which means the sentence length
5248         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced.
5249         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5250         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5251         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5252         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5253         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5254         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5255         */
5256        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5257                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency)
5258        {
5259            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5260                    midPunctuationFrequency, -1);
5261        }
5262        /**
5263         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5264         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field.
5265         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5266         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5267         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5268         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5269         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5270         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5271         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5272         */
5273        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5274                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5275        {
5276            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5277                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5278        }
5279
5280        /**
5281         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified; each value is referenced directly except for {@code rng},
5282         * which will not change or be directly referenced (a new GWTRNG will be used with the same state value).
5283         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5284         * @param rng a StatefulRNG that will not be directly referenced; the state will be copied into a new StatefulRNG
5285         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5286         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5287         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5288         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5289         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5290         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5291         */
5292        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, IStatefulRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords,
5293                            String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
5294                            double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5295        {
5296            this.language = language;
5297            this.rng = new GWTRNG(rng.getState());
5298            this.minWords = minWords;
5299            this.maxWords = maxWords;
5300            this.midPunctuation = midPunctuation;
5301            this.endPunctuation = endPunctuation;
5302            this.midPunctuationFrequency = midPunctuationFrequency;
5303            this.maxChars = maxChars;
5304        }
5305        public String sentence()
5306        {
5307            return language.sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5308                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5309        }
5310
5311        public String serializeToString() {
5312            return language.serializeToString() + '℘' +
5313                    rng.getState() + '℘' +
5314                    minWords + '℘' +
5315                    maxWords + '℘' +
5316                    StringKit.join("ℙ", midPunctuation) + '℘' +
5317                    StringKit.join("ℙ", endPunctuation) + '℘' +
5318                    NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(midPunctuationFrequency) + '℘' +
5319                    maxChars;
5320        }
5321        public static SentenceForm deserializeFromString(String ser)
5322        {
5323            int gap = ser.indexOf('℘');
5324            FakeLanguageGen lang = FakeLanguageGen.deserializeFromString(ser.substring(0, gap));
5325            GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(
5326                    StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5327            int minWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5328            int maxWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5329            String[] midPunctuation =
5330                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5331            String[] endPunctuation =
5332                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5333            double midFreq = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble(StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5334            int maxChars = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, ser.length());
5335            return new SentenceForm(lang, rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midFreq, maxChars);
5336        }
5337    }
5338}
